clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Functions in Patients Before and After Bariatric Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The project will specifically focus on the examination of the influence of substantial weight loss due to bariatric surgery on brain functions. Our hypothesis is that substantial weight loss after Bariatric Surgery (BS) or dietary intervention is also accompanied by changes in the balance of reward and inhibitory networks. Therefore the investigators will conduct a functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) study investigating functional and structural measures.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Differential brain functions in reward and inhibitory control networks
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre and and at lease one 6 months post bariatric surgery
primary_outcome.description: brain functions will be measured by blood oxygen level dependent effects and by cerebral blood flow

secondary_outcome.measure: Structural differences due to bariatric surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre and at least 6 months post bariatric surgery
secondary_outcome.description: structural measures will be performed by diffusion tensor imaging and structural T1 and T2 im images

other_outcome.time_frame: pre and at least 6 months post baritric surgery

study_pop.textblock: volunteers pre and post bariatric surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- bariatric surgery in the past or in the future
Exclusion Criteria:
- fMRI contraindications
- claustrophobia
